how would you describe your main use cas: Note-taking;Journalling;Task and project management (including CRMs);As a knowledge base (including technical, non-fiction and encyclopaedic content);Producing/publishing interactive fiction;Worldbuilding (e.g. for role-playing games);Narrative fiction writing (either supporting its creation or directly writing in TiddlyWiki)
do you share your tiddlywiki(s) with oth: No, my TiddlyWiki is for personal use only
putting it all together, what value does: I use TW mostly for my video game universe, integrating elements of journalling, task management, non-fiction research data-basing, hypertextual narrative design, and World Building. I work more in the audio world in REAPER, and prefer TWs similar community driven customizability
what is your level of ability with tiddl: I have customised TiddlyWiki through options and plugins;I am comfortable using WikiText widgets (e.g. <$transclude>, <$list>...);I have written custom CSS styles
how do you save changes in tiddlywiki?: Single-file wiki with TiddlyDesktop;Single-file wiki with third-party desktop app (e.g. TidGi Desktop, twexe)
how do you back up/sync changes between: N/A - I keep my wiki on a single system

outside of plugins, palettes and other i:
I use quite a few stylesheets which i have found through discussions in the community or on other tiddlys, often with my own customizations. 
I have a few custom macros built off others work to create structures for collapsible character bios and other similar structures.
what are we doing well? prompts for thin: FOSS FTW! I personally love the decentralized community approach. I think discussions I've heard from the devs themselves sound like they are mostly going in the right directions, and the community has so many cool projects going. Since finding TW last year I've become a bit of an evangelist, showing it off to all my friends, and I don't think that will change any time soon the way its being run.
what could we do better? prompts for thi:
I'll keep using TW, i adopted it because it felt sturdy for long-term use.
I have no fears about TWs future.
I don't really see any problems at all wit hthe TW community, its been so helpful and supportive to me. 
I might contribute more to the project if there were better mobile tools, thats the one thing that i feel hasn't caught up, beyond fully capitalized, italic, bold, SAVING haha, but i think thats well known. A better mobile app would really help me and others use it more, etc.
with your consent, we would like to publ: Yes, I am happy for my responses to be published
